intro: Tithymalus deflexus, commonly known as the bent tithymalus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clustered umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a distinct, aromatic scent. Tithymalus deflexus is noted for its ecological importance as a food source for various pollinators and insects.
